title: Church and state for Puritans - characteristic

content.question: Which of the following characterizes the relationship between church and state for the Puritans who settled the Massachusetts Bay Colony in the seventeenth century?

choices.label: The colonial government officially supported religious toleration.
Colonial officials strictly separated church and state.
Colonial officials encouraged churches to incorporate Catholic elements of worship.
Church membership was required for voting and holding public office.

content.answer: Church membership was required for voting and holding public office.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify a historical concept, development, or process.
